JobFullDesc: In People & Places, we handle all things people-related so our employees around the globe are empowered to do their best work. In Global Rewards, we build and drive employee rewards programs globally, like benefits and compensation. Uber is searching for a Compensation Analyst to support our growing employee population. This role will be a key contributor in the development and implementation of compensation strategies, focusing on our compensation programs. The ideal candidate is enthusiastic about attracting and rewarding the best talent, with a knack for getting things done. Our rapid expansion brings us unique challenges -- join us as we strive to innovate and create new solutions! This role will be based in our office in San Francisco, CA.   What You’ll DoApply your expertise in quantitative analysis to develop dashboards and analytic models which provide crucial compensation insights,  to help inform and  influence business decisionsKey contributor in developing and executing global compensation programs (cyclical and ad hoc) and other people team initiatives, such as annual bonus/equity award programs, location strategy, or compensation benchmarking. Manage compensation structures through HRIS solutions to  efficiently scale and sustain program delivery and  build reusable analytics to automate insights and findings. Formulate recommendations regarding regular review and updates to the compensation structure.Design compensation metrics, reports, and tools to inform program decisions and forecast or analyze business outcomesParticipate in the research for and ongoing development of new hire compensation programs that match Uber’s needsCollect and analyze competitive salary information through compensation surveys to help set the company's market positionProduce ad hoc analyses with quick turnarounds based on business requests Basic QualificationsA minimum of two (2+) years of experience in compensation, finance, or a related field supporting People organizations Preferred QualificationsAdvanced modeling skillsAttention to detail. Partnering with People organization and business leaders to craft people strategies that motivate and retain employees - while having a robust change management process tightly managed throughoutProject Management experience.
